prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As I said earlier, I was assigned to guard duty in the Allebahstian Embassy.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: After I saw the Steel Samurai off on his way towards the ambassador's office...
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I returned to the rose garden for a bit, and checked up on the security situation.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: After all the preparations were in place, I was called back by Ambassador Alba to his office.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: When I arrived, Ambassador Alba was watering the flowers on the windowsill.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 5
Testimony: There were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by going through the provided information carefully.

First, the characters listed include Kay Faraday, Byrne Faraday, Calisto Yew, and others. The key here is the evidence and testimonies. The user wants one pair where an evidence and testimony contradict each other.

Looking at the evidences, Evidence 14 is about the Passionflowers. The description says there are two large flowers in bloom, supported by stakes, and Ambassador Alba takes care of them. The key detail here is that there are two flowers.

Now, the testimonies are from Franziska. Testimony 5 states that when she arrived at Ambassador Alba's office, there were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box. 

Wait a second, the evidence says two, and the testimony mentions four. That's a direct contradiction in the number of flowers. So, Evidence 14 (which mentions two flowers) and Testimony 5 (which says four) must be the conflicting pair. 

I should double-check to make sure there's no other conflicting info. Let me confirm the numbers again. Evidence 14 clearly states "Two large flowers in bloom," while Testimony 5 from Franziska says "four large passionflowers." That's a clear numerical discrepancy. 

No other evidence or testimony mentions the exact number of passionflowers, so this must be the correct pair. The answer should be Evidence 14 and Testimony 5.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The answer should be in JSON format, specifying the evidence and testimony numbers.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see if there's an evidence that directly contradicts it. Let's look at the testimonies from Lang (Character 8):

Testimony 0: Lang questions if Babahl's statue was draped in Yatagarasu's clothes and shot over. He seems skeptical about the statue flying.
Testimony 1: He argues that even if arrows were used, the statue wouldn't go far because it's heavy.
Testimony 2: He's asking what else could have been launched besides the statue.
Testimony 3: He states the Primidux Statue didn't grow wings, implying it couldn't fly.
Testimony 4: A rhetorical question about being a realist.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially those related to the Primidux Statue and crossbows. Evidence 30 mentions Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows, which are actually crossbow arrows made from passionflower stakes. The description says they were used as crossbow arrows. 

Evidence 16 describes the Allebahst's Primidux Statue, noting that it was moved during the murder and used as a weapon. However, the key point here might be Evidence 30's crossbow arrows. If the crossbow arrows were used to launch something, perhaps the statue wasn't the projectile but was moved via other means.

Wait, Testimony 0 and 1 from Lang suggest that the statue couldn't have been launched because it's too heavy. But if Evidence 30's crossbow arrows were used to shoot something else (like the real statue?), then maybe the statue wasn't the projectile. Alternatively, maybe the crossbow arrows were part of a mechanism to move the statue, contradicting Lang's assumption that it couldn't fly or be moved that way.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 30's description: the arrows are made from passionflower stakes, which were originally support stakes for the flowers. Since Ambassador Alba's passionflowers are in Allebahst (Evidence 14 mentions two flowers), maybe the crossbow arrows came from there. If the crossbow was used to launch something else (like the real statue from Babahl to Allebahst), that would contradict Lang's testimonies that the statue couldn't be moved that way. 

Wait, Evidence 16 says the Allebahst's statue was moved during the murder. So maybe the real statue was moved using crossbow arrows, which contradicts Lang's Testimony 3 that the statue didn't sprout wings (i.e., couldn't move on its own). The evidence shows it was moved, but how? If crossbow arrows were used to move it (like a mechanism), that would mean Lang's assumption it couldn't be moved is wrong. But the testimonies are more about the method (flying via arrows?), so the contradiction might be between Evidence 30 (crossbow arrows exist) and Testimony 1, which says even with arrows, the statue wouldn't go far. 

Alternatively, maybe the crossbow arrows were used to shoot something else, allowing the statue to be moved without flying. But I'm not sure. Let me check again.

Another angle: Testimony 3 says the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings, implying it couldn't fly. If there's evidence that the statue was moved via another method (like being carried or using the crossbow arrows in a different way), that would contradict Lang's assumption that it couldn't be moved that way. Evidence 16 says the Allebahst's statue was moved during the murder, so the movement happened, but how? The crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) might have been part of a mechanism to move it, which Lang dismissed as impossible. 

Alternatively, maybe the crossbow arrows were used to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6, which is the Babahl's fake statue swapped with the real one from Allebahst). Wait, Evidence 6 says Babahl's statue is fake, swapped with the real one from Allebahst. So the real Allebahst statue was in Babahl? Then moving it would require some method. If crossbow arrows were used in that process, then Lang's testimony that it couldn't be moved with arrows is contradicted by the existence of crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) that could have been used in the movement.

Hmm, perhaps the contradiction is between Evidence 30 (crossbow arrows exist) and Testimony 1, which says even with arrows, the statue wouldn't go far. But the arrows might not be for launching the statue but for something else. 

Alternatively, Testimony 0 mentions the statue being draped and shot over, implying maybe the Yatagarasu tried to move it via crossbow, but Lang thinks it's impossible. If Evidence 30 shows that crossbow arrows were present, perhaps they were used in a different way, like to shoot someone or something else, contradicting the idea that they were used for the statue. 

Alternatively, maybe the key is that Evidence 30's arrows are crossbow arrows, which could have been used to launch the real statue (since they are part of the smuggling or theft). If the statue was moved using these arrows, then Lang's Testimony 3 that the statue didn't sprout wings (couldn't move) is contradicted by the evidence that it was moved (Evidence 16). But the contradiction would be between Evidence 16 and Testimony 3, but the question requires an evidence and testimony pair.

Wait, Testimony 3 says the statue didn't sprout wings, so couldn't fly. Evidence 16 says the Allebahst's statue was moved during the murder. The movement doesn't necessarily involve flying, so maybe Lang's point is that it couldn't have been launched via crossbow arrows (as per Testimony 1). If the crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) were used to shoot something else that allowed the statue to be moved (e.g., breaking a barrier), then that contradicts Lang's assumption. 

Alternatively, maybe the arrows were used to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6 is the fake in Babahl, so real is in Allebahst?), but I'm getting confused. Let me check the evidence descriptions again:

Evidence 6 (Babahl's Primidux Statue): It was a fake, swapped with the real one from Allebahst. So the real statue is in Babahl's embassy? Then the Allebahst's statue (Evidence 16) would be the fake one. 

Evidence 16 (Allebahst's Primidux Statue): Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office, so they swapped them. 

So the real Allebahst statue was in Babahl, and the fake is in Allebahst. The movement involved swapping them. If the crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) were used in this swap (maybe to shoot a mechanism?), then Lang's Testimony 1 that the statue couldn't be moved with arrows is contradicted because the arrows were part of the method. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 30 (crossbow arrows exist and were used) and Testimony 1 (arrows wouldn't move the statue). But the testimony says even with arrows, it wouldn't go far. The evidence shows arrows were present, but maybe they were used for another purpose. 

Alternatively, maybe the arrows were used to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6) which was in Babahl, allowing it to be moved. But I'm not sure. 

Alternatively, Testimony 2 asks what was launched if not the statue. If the crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) were used to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6), then that's the answer. But the evidence doesn't explicitly say they were used for that. 

Alternatively, Evidence 30's arrows are part of the crossbow used to launch something else, which allowed the statue to be moved without flying, contradicting Lang's Testimony 3's point about the statue not having wings. 

I think the key is that Testimony 3 says the statue couldn't fly (no wings), but Evidence 16 says it was moved during the murder. The movement doesn't require flying, so maybe the contradiction is not there.

If Evidence 30 shows that crossbow arrows were present, maybe they were used to shoot the statue, but Testimony 1 says even with arrows, it wouldn't go far. So the existence of the arrows (Evidence 30) doesn't directly contradict that; the contradiction would be if there was evidence that the statue was indeed moved by arrows, but I don't see that. 

Alternatively, maybe the crossbow arrows were used to shoot someone or something else, making Lang's assumption about their use incorrect, but that's a stretch. 

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me look for another angle. 

Looking at Testimony 3: "I don't think I need to tell you that the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings." So Lang is saying it couldn't fly. Evidence 16 says the Allebahst's statue was moved during the murder. The movement could be via human transport, not flying. So there's no contradiction there.

Alternatively, maybe Evidence 30's arrows are the ones used in the crossbow to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6) which was in Babahl, allowing it to be moved to Allebahst. Evidence 30's arrows exist, so maybe they were used to shoot something else that allowed the statue to be moved, contradicting the idea that arrows couldn't move it. 

Alternatively, maybe the crossbow arrows were used to shoot the real statue's stand or mechanism, enabling it to be moved without flying. Thus, the existence of the arrows (Evidence 30) contradicts Testimony 1's assertion that even with arrows, it wouldn't work. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 30 and Testimony 1.

Evidence 30 is "Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows". 

Testimonies are numbered 0 to 4 for Lang's statements. 

The pair would be evidence 30 and testimony 1.

Another angle: Testimony 0 mentions the Yatagarasu draping the statue in their clothes and shooting it over. Therefore, the pair is Evidence 16 and Testimony 1. 

Wait, but Testimony 1 is from Lang, and Evidence 16 is about the Allebahst's statue being moved. So Testimony 1 is about the Babahl's statue being shot over, but Evidence 16's movement is of the Allebahst's statue. Maybe they are different statues.

If Evidence 30's arrows were used to launch something else (like the real statue from Babahl), then the answer is that the crossbow arrows were used for that, contradicting Testimony 1's claim that the statue couldn't be moved with arrows. 

Alternatively, the crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) were used to shoot the real statue (Evidence 6) which was in Babahl, allowing it to be moved to Allebahst, hence contradicting Testimony 1's statement that even with arrows, the statue wouldn't go far. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 30 and Testimony 1. 

So the answer would be {"evidence":30, "testimony":1} 

Wait, but let me check the evidence descriptions again.

Alternatively, maybe the arrows were used in another way, but the existence of the arrows doesn't directly contradict the testimony unless they were used in a way that made the statue move. Since the evidence doesn't explicitly state that, maybe it's not the contradiction. 

Hmm, maybe I'm missing something. Let me look for another possible pair.

If there's evidence that the statue was moved via some mechanism that didn't require wings, like using the crossbow arrows to move it without flying, then Testimony 3 is contradicted by the evidence of movement. prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Kay:
Then you mean, Ambassador Alba is the real killer? But I thought the two of them were friends?
Edgeworth:
Maybe they were, but what if Mr. Coachen was the one who first betrayed their friendship?
Kay:
Oh, I get it! Wasn't Mr. Coachen pushing really hard for Mr. Palaeno... ...to be ambassador after the reunification?
Edgeworth:
Yes, and that was the real reason why he wanted to steal Allebahst's Primidux Statue.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Frankly, I still don't understand why I am being placed under suspicion here.
Person: Alba
Testimony 1
Testimony: Under your hypothetical scenario, Mr. Coachen and I were fellow smugglers.
Person: Alba
Testimony 2
Testimony: In that case, what motive would I have had to kill my co-conspirator?
Person: Alba
Testimony 3
Testimony: But to get to the point, I was in Allebahst the whole time.
Person: Alba
Testimony 4
Testimony: So, it's simply not possible for me to have killed him in Babahl. That is my alibi.
Person: Alba

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that conflicts.

Looking at the testimonies first, Testimony 3 from Alba says he was in Allebahst the entire time, so he couldn't have killed Coachen in Babahl. His alibi is being in Allebahst. Now, I need to check the evidences to see which one contradicts this.

Evidence 36 is the Security Footage. Its description mentions that footage shows someone in the Steel Samurai costume pushing a pushcart into Babahl. The pushcart has a bulge. Now, if Alba claims he was in Allebahst, but the Security Footage shows someone entering Babahl, that could be a contradiction if that someone is Alba. Wait, but the Steel Samurai is Larry Butz (Character 10), so maybe the person in the costume is Larry, but the key point here is the location. If the footage shows someone entering Babahl, and Alba says he was in Allebahst, but if the evidence shows he was in Babahl, that would contradict.

Wait, the Security Footage's info says: "Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart." If Alba was in Allebahst, but the footage shows someone entering Babahl, then unless that someone is Alba, it might not directly contradict. However, maybe the Steel Samurai's presence in Babahl is part of the scenario, but perhaps the key point is that the Security Footage shows movement between the countries. Alternatively, maybe another evidence contradicts Alba's alibi more directly.

Looking at Evidence 37, the Pushcart's description mentions it was pushed to Allebahst from the dressing room, but that's the opposite direction. Wait, the Security Footage says into Babahl, while the Pushcart's description says pushed to Allebahst. Maybe conflicting details there, but that's between evidence 36 and 37, not directly related to Alba's testimony.

Wait, let's look at other evidences. Evidence 30: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows. The description says they were passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office, but turned out to be crossbow arrows. If Alba was in Allebahst, maybe he used these arrows in the crime, but that's not directly about his location.

Evidence 29: Revolving Fireplace Wall was used, which might allow moving between countries without being detected. If Alba used that to move between, then his alibi is weak. But the testimony says he was in Allebahst the whole time, so maybe the Security Footage (36) showing someone entering Babahl could be him, contradicting his alibi.

Alternatively, Evidence 35: Commemorative Photo shows the murder weapon in Alba's bouquet. If that photo was taken at the time of the murder, then Alba was present, contradicting his alibi. Wait, the photo is taken at Theatrum Neutralis, which is the shared building. If the murder happened in Babahl, and the photo was taken there, maybe that's the key. But the testimony says he was in Allebahst the whole time, so if the photo places him in Babahl during the murder, that would contradict.

Wait, the Commemorative Photo (Evidence 35) says it was taken at Theatrum Neutralis, where both countries' areas are. If the murder was in Babahl, and the photo shows Alba with the weapon, then he must have been there, contradicting his alibi of staying in Allebahst. That's a possible contradiction.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says he couldn't have killed in Babahl because he was in Allebahst. Evidence 35's photo might show him in Babahl during the time, which would contradict that.

Alternatively, Evidence 36's Security Footage shows someone entering Babahl in the Steel Samurai costume. If that someone is Alba, but the Steel Samurai is Larry (Character 10), maybe not. Unless the costume was a disguise for Alba.

Alternatively, Evidence 28: Wire found in Babahl's grandfather clock. If Alba was in Allebahst, how did the wire end up there unless he placed it while being there, contradicting his alibi.

Wait, but the key point is Alba's testimony that he was in Allebahst the entire time, so he couldn't have been in Babahl to commit the murder. The Security Footage (Evidence 36) shows someone entering Babahl, but if that someone is Alba (maybe in disguise as the Steel Samurai?), then that would contradict his alibi.

The Steel Samurai is Larry Butz (Character 10), but the Security Footage's info says "Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl." If that someone is Alba disguised, then he was in Babahl, contradicting his testimony. But the Steel Samurai's real identity is Larry, so maybe the person is Larry, but that doesn't affect Alba's alibi.

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check again:

Alba's testimony (Testimony 4) claims he was in Allebahst the whole time, so couldn't have been in Babahl to kill Coachen. The evidence that contradicts this would need to show he was in Babahl.

Evidence 36's Security Footage shows someone entering Babahl. If that someone is Alba, then that's a contradiction. But how do we know it's him? The Steel Samurai is Larry, so unless the Steel Samurai costume was a disguise for Alba, but that's not stated. Alternatively, maybe the Security Footage shows Alba himself, but the description doesn't specify. 

Alternatively, Evidence 35: Commemorative Photo shows the murder weapon in Alba's bouquet. If that photo was taken at the time of the murder, then Alba was present at the scene (in Babahl), contradicting his alibi. The photo was taken at Theatrum Neutralis, which is the shared building, so if the murder was in Babahl part, then Alba being there would mean he was in Babahl, contradicting his testimony.

So the Commemorative Photo (Evidence 35) shows Alba with the murder weapon, implying he was present in Babahl during the murder, contradicting his claim of being in Allebahst the whole time. Therefore, Evidence 35 and Testimony 4 (Alba's testimony 4) contradict each other.

Wait, but the user's previous examples had pairs like evidence 30 and testimony 1, so maybe another pair here. Let me confirm:

The testimony says Alba was in Allebahst, so couldn't have been in Babahl. If the photo (Evidence 35) shows him in Babahl at the time, that's the contradiction.

So the answer would be {"evidence": 35, "testimony": 4}

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 36's Security Footage: if the footage shows someone entering Babahl, but Alba says he was in Allebahst, then unless that someone is him, but the description says "someone in the Steel Samurai costume", which is Larry, so maybe that's not him. 

Therefore, the strongest contradiction is between Evidence 35 and Testimony 4.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony to see where there might be inconsistencies.

First, looking at the testimonies from Ambassador Alba (Character 9). His Testimony 3 says: "There is no way for me to have transported his body from the theater to Babahl!" He's arguing that moving the body would be impossible, implying that the murder happened in the theater and the body was found in Babahl. 

Now, let me check the evidence related to the body's location. Evidence 3 (Notes on Coachen's Body) states that the COD was a stab to the neck and mentions that the body wasn't badly burnt by the fire. But more importantly, Evidence 36 (Security Footage) mentions that someone in the Steel Samurai costume pushed a pushcart into Babahl, which had a bulge. Evidence 37 (Pushcart) also says the Steel Samurai pushed it to Allebahst from the dressing room, but there's blood inside. Wait, that might be conflicting.

Wait, actually, looking at Testimony 3 from Alba, he claims that transporting the body from the theater to Babahl is impossible. But if the body was found in Babahl, then the murder could have occurred there. However, the Commemorative Photo (Evidence 35) shows the murder weapon in Alba's bouquet, which was taken at Theatrum Neutralis. That suggests the weapon was at the theater, implying the murder might have happened there. But if the body was found in Babahl, that would mean the body was moved. 

Alternatively, maybe the murder happened in the theater, and the body was transported. But Alba is saying that's impossible. However, the Security Footage (Evidence 36) shows someone pushing a pushcart into Babahl with a bulge. The Pushcart (Evidence 37) has blood inside, suggesting it was used to transport the body. So if the pushcart was used to move the body from the theater (Allebahst) to Babahl, then Alba's testimony that it's impossible to transport the body contradicts the evidence of the pushcart being used for that purpose. 

Therefore, Testimony 3 (Alba's claim that transporting the body is impossible) is contradicted by Evidence 37 (Pushcart used to transport the body into Babahl). So the pair would be Evidence 37 and Testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair where an evidence contradicts a testimony. The key here is to carefully read through each evidence and testimony to spot any inconsistencies.

First, I'll look at the testimonies given by Ambassador Alba. Testimony 3 mentions that one of the scenes was the Steel Samurai's "Early Summer Rain Jab" move. But according to Evidence 15 (Samurai Spear), Larry hit the spear against a wall and bent it, making it hollow. Because of this, he couldn't perform the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack. 

So, if the testimony claims that the move was part of the show, but the evidence states that the spear was bent and thus the move couldn't be done, there's a direct contradiction here. The evidence shows the move wasn't possible, while the testimony says it was performed. That makes the pair Evidence 15 and Testimony 3 the contradiction.

I should double-check other testimonies and evidences to ensure there's no better pair, but this seems solid. The key point is the impossibility of the move due to the bent spear versus the testimony claiming it was part of the performance.
